image.altText: A photo of a gas exploration project. The image is taken by a drone and shows a busy mine.

props.synopsis: Native title lawyers and environmentalists are warning the NT's proposed Territory Coordinator bill could erode Indigenous land rights and open the door to nuclear waste storage in the territory.

title.children: Fears Territory Coordinator law could erode Indigenous, environment rights

image.altText: An empty bottle of hand sanitiser on light brown first covered with small sticks

props.synopsis: Community leaders in Alice Springs say they are concerned drinking hand sanitiser has become an ongoing problem for the town's most vulnerable people. Some experts are calling for greater regulations around the sale of the product.

title.children: Drinking hand sanitiser an ongoing problem for most vulnerable in Alice Springs

image.altText: a drone shot of a mining camp in Central Australia.

props.synopsis: Arafura Rare Earths' Nolans Project will receive $200 million from a federal government fund, bringing total public investment to more than $1 billion.

title.children: New funding takes public investment in NT rare earths mine past $1b

image.altText: The exterior of the Alice Springs Local Court building.

props.synopsis: A man has faced court charged with murder after his partner was found dead in Alice Springs in the early hours of Monday morning.

title.children: Man charged with murder after woman found dead by Alice Springs riverbed

image.altText: An aerial view of an exploration well in the Northern Territory's Beetaloo Basin on a patch of cleared land surrounded by bush

props.synopsis: The NT's environmental regulator is investigating the "inadvertent release" of highly salinated water near a fracking site in the Northern Territory's Beetaloo Basin. Environmental experts and advocates are warning the incident could be a sign of things to come.

title.children: Contaminated water pumped onto vegetation at Beetaloo Basin fracking site

image.altText: An aerial view shows a fishing boat moored near rocks

props.synopsis: Officials are investigating whether organised crime is behind a wave of illegal foreign fishing boats in Australian waters, which locals say are more sophisticated than ever before.

title.children: 'Unprecedented surge' in foreign boats entering Australian waters

image.altText: Tristian Schoolkate pumps his fist and yells while holding his tennis racquet in celebration

props.synopsis: Defending men's champion Jannik Sinner battles Australian wildcard Tristan Schoolkate while the Special K duo of Kyrgios and Kokkinakis face fellow Aussies Vukic and Duckworth. Follow live.

title.children: Aussie wildcard faces world number one, Kyrgios and Kokkinakis team up

image.altText: A string of clouds in a dark sky

props.synopsis: Intense storms continue to sweep over large parts of New South Wales, bringing marine-rescue dramas and giant hail to northern areas of the state.

title.children: Teen rescued from adrift vessel as wild storm front hits northern NSW

image.altText: A building engulfed in flames at night.

props.synopsis: The NSW Mid North Coast community is rallying to support its fishers after a blaze tore through the Laurieton seafood co-op, which has been an institution for locals and tourists visiting the region for nearly 50 years.

title.children: Fire destroys 'iconic' NSW seafood co-op amid peak tourist season

image.altText: Mother charged infant

props.synopsis: A 34-year-old social media influencer has been accused of torturing her baby daughter and taking photos of her in "immense distress and pain" to elicit donations.

title.children: Influencer accused of torturing her baby and taking photos of her in pain

image.altText: A woman in green scrubs holding a phone to her ear stands behind a desk in a hospital, with an older woman and young man in back

props.synopsis: Next week, more than two-thirds of NSW's psychiatrists working in its public hospital sector are set to resign, potentially causing serious harm for the state's healthcare system. But how did we get here?

title.children: Why the majority of NSW's public psychiatrists plan to resign next week

image.altText: A woman stands in the street looking as flames and smoke billow from the windows of a home.

props.synopsis: Police say two people who caused a fatal explosion which killed a woman in Truganina may have targeted the wrong home.

title.children: Family 'utterly devastated' after 27-year-old woman dies in arson attack

image.altText: Amanda Rishworth takes questions from reporters at the Flagstaff Hill shopping centre in her southern Adelaide electorate

props.synopsis: Amanda Rishworth will become the new NDIS Minister and Anika Wells has been promoted to cabinet in a reshuffle following Bill Shorten's retirement.

title.children: Albanese announces pre-election reshuffle, hands NDIS to Rishworth

image.altText: a crowd of young Arab men throwing their hands up in a street at night

props.synopsis: The ceasefire deal between Israel and Hamas could halt the war in Gaza and see the release of Israeli hostages and Palestinian prisoners. This is what we know about the multiple stages.

title.children: What we know about the ceasefire deal between Israel and Hamas

image.altText: Keren wears a t-shirt that says "Bring Them Home Now" while looking out a window.

props.synopsis: Members of Australia's Palestinian and Jewish communities say the hope and anticipation following a ceasefire deal is being shadowed by trepidation about whether it will hold and what the future will look like.

title.children: Palestinian and Jewish Australians share hope after ceasefire deal, but fears remain

image.altText: The sign and facade of the Bunbury Museum, where the boy was injured.

props.synopsis: A young boy has been flown to Perth with critical injuries after an incident at a museum in the state's South West.

title.children: Five-year-old crushed by parking meter airlifted to Perth in critical condition

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A line of firefighters in yellow uniforms walks along a mountain ridge

props.synopsis: Firefighters have made progress in containing two massive wildfires burning around Los Angeles, as another bout of fan-flaming winds moves through southern California.

title.children: Fire crews report significant gains in Los Angeles despite winds

image.altText: Group of city workers walking on street

props.synopsis: Australia's unemployment rate rose to 4 per cent in December as more people looked for work, while the local share market ended higher after gains on Wall Street overnight.

title.children: Unemployment rate climbs in December, ASX ends higher after gains on Wall St — as it happened

image.altText: Peter Dutton speaks at a press conference in brisbane

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton is well known for his "tough guy" persona,. But with teal seats in the Coalition's sights, the approach could spell trouble for the opposition leader

title.children: The clock is ticking on Peter Dutton's 'gentle giant' rebrand

image.altText: Two men with their arms around each other

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's pick for secretary of state appears to have ended months of speculation on whether the incoming administration would back the AUKUS submarine deal, saying it will have Trump's strong support.

title.children: Trump administration will back AUKUS submarines deal, says Rubio

image.altText: Protestors in Washington hold signs like 'I'm one of 170 million Americans on TikTok'

props.synopsis: With TikTok due to be blocked in the United States this weekend, we speak to an expert to help us unpack the likely ramifications.

title.children: What the TikTok ban in the US actually means

image.altText: A blue image of the comet as a white trail across the screen

props.synopsis: The Sun-skirter comet C/2024 G3 is visible from the southern hemisphere this week as it makes its second-ever swing around our Sun.

title.children: How to see the rare 'Sun-skirter' comet entering our skies this week

image.altText: A man wearing a blue shirt speaks to the media.

props.synopsis: The Fair Work Commission has suspended the protected industrial action impacting Sydney's train system until next week. But what do the unions want and what is being offered?

title.children: What's behind the dispute that has thrown Sydney's rail network into disarray

image.altText: A drone shot of the Whyalla pellet plant.

props.synopsis: Energy and Mining Minister Tom Koutsantonis says iron mining job losses linked to GFG's Whyalla steelworks 'could have been avoided'.

title.children: SA Energy Minister slams GFG over 350 iron mining job losses

image.altText: A close-up shot of the District Court of WA in Perth, showing signage on the building's front facade with the court's name.

props.synopsis: In a likely precedent-setting court case involving two companies, a business that received a fraudulent invoice email is ordered to pay costs to an electrical contractor who was hacked.

title.children: Company scammed out of $192k via fake invoice ordered to pay bill

image.altText: A man in a suit with black hair looking solemn

props.synopsis: After a weeks-long game of hide and seek, South Korea's president Yoon Suk Yeol has finally emerged from the shadows. The saga has exposed the nation's political division.

title.children: After a game of hide and seek, South Korea's president emerges defiant

image.altText: A radio telescope superimposed on top of an image of a pulsar.

props.synopsis: Australian researchers have discovered a dead star that takes hours rather than milliseconds to spin, challenging scientists' understanding of how these stars form.

title.children: Rule-breaking spinning star discovered by Australian astronomers

image.altText: A collage of Drake performing live with a confused expression and Kendrick Lamar in a still from his Squabble Up music video

props.synopsis: Drake is suing his label, Universal Music Group, for defamation over Kendrick Lamar's track 'Not Like Us', a move the record company calls "illogical".

title.children: Drake sues his label for defamation over Kendrick Lamar's 'Not Like Us'

image.altText: A man wearing a yellow high-vis vest over a black suit and tie stands in front of a blue bus speaking into two microphones.

props.synopsis: The ACT government insists most of its electric bus fleet is working as expected despite Transport Canberra having to send several vehicles back to their Sydney-based manufacturer due to technical issues.

title.children: Four electric buses pulled from Canberra roads after just months in service

image.altText: An old black and white photo of Alan Green sitting at a desk with a Quiksilver book in front of him

props.synopsis: Alan Green, who founded iconic Australian surf brand Quiksilver in 1969, passed away at his home in Victoria's Torquay, following a brief cancer battle.

title.children: Founder of surf brand Quiksilver, Alan Green, dies aged 77

image.altText: A man with mud on his face in the forrest.

props.synopsis: How Australian Oscar Jenkins, a regular civilian working as a biology teacher, ended up fighting alongside seasoned commandos in the Ukrainian International Legion.

title.children: Australian teacher needed no combat experience to fight for Ukraine

image.altText: Tent at beachside camping area.

props.synopsis: "Ghost camping", the practice of leaving an unoccupied tent or caravan on a campsite to reserve the spot, is again a hot topic as frustrated holiday-makers struggle to find a site at their favourite Tassie campground.

title.children: Full but not occupied: Ghost camping rears its head in Tasmania
